授業目的: To introduce students to the origins and historical development of Christianity, its presence in the world today, some Christian theology and language and expressions of Christian faith, and the Bible. Students will also learn about Christianity’s influence on empires, societies, and social justice movements past and present.
到達目標: To become knowledgeable about the origin and historical development of Christianity and some of Christianity’s basic concepts.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Lecture, discussions, guest speakers, journal entries, and presentations

第1回:
*Face to face format for all 14 lectures.
April 13th: Introduction – Course overview, purpose, & class guidance; sharing of one another’s cultural and religious backgrounds; asking questions; invitation to journaling/reflections. (In-class written assignment #1 - to be handed in at the end of the class)
Please bring a blank notebook/journal to write in throughout the course.
第2回:
*Face to face format for all 14 lectures.
April 20th: Easter - Who is Jesus? Christianity - its origins
Please bring a Bible if you have one. If not, there will be copies in the KGU Library and/or in class.
第3回:
*Face to face format for all 14 lectures.
April 27th: The Hebrew Bible – origins, books/contents, authors, and key themes (Student journal/reflection #1 submission)
Please bring your Bible to class. There may be some Bible readings announced before class.
第4回:
May 4th - National holiday
May 11th: The New Testament - General overview and The gospels
Please bring your Bible to class. There may be some Bible readings announced before class.
第5回: May 18th: The New Testament - Jesus' parables - what is a parable? some examples to learn from and explore together (Student journal/reflection #2 submission)
Please bring your Bible to class. There may be some Bible readings announced before class.
第6回:
May 25th: The New Testament - Paul's letters and more - Christianity and its early church formation
(Written assignment #2 due)
Please bring your Bible to class. Additional readings will be assigned in May.
第7回: June 1st: The Middle Ages and the Renaissance c500-1500
Any assigned readings will be posted in May.
第8回:
June 8th: Church Reformation c1500-1650 and into the Modern era c1650-1914
(Student journal/reflections submission #3)
Any assigned readings will be posted in May.
第9回: June 15th: Christianity in the 20th & 21st century - 1914 - Present
Any assigned readings will be posted in May.
第11回:
June 29th: Christianity in North America/Canadian contexts
Guest lecture (virtual): Canadian Indigenous leadership: The Rev. Mary Fontaine, Director of Hummingbird Ministries, Presbytery of Westminster, British Columbia, the Presbyterian Church in Canada
(Student journal/reflections submission #4)
Any assigned readings will be posted in June.
第12回:
July 6th: Christianity from a Canadian multicultural perspective
Guest lecture (virtual): Canadian Intercultural leadership: The Rev. Hyuk Cho, Associate Professor and Director of United Church Faith Formation and Studies, Vancouver School of Theology, Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
Any assigned readings will be posted in June.
